Class GameViewManager

java.lang.Object
view.GameViewManager
public class GameViewManager extends Object
The GameViewManager class is responsible for managing the core game mechanics and the game view. This includes loading game assets, handling animations, updating player interactions, and managing the game state.

Main responsibilities include:

  • Loading game backgrounds, objects, and player assets.
  • Managing player and object interactions such as feeding, playing, and scoring.
  • Handling progress bars for health, hunger, happiness, and sleep.
  • Creating and displaying the game loop.
  • Handling game pause/resume and saving game states.
Since:
2024
Version:
2.0
Author:
Grant Von Hogen, Shivansh Kushwaha, Mahip Varlani, Maya Al Hourani, Keito Hyde

  • Constructor Details

    • GameViewManager

      public GameViewManager()
      Constructs a new GameViewManager instance, initializing the core components required for the game environment and setting up the necessary configurations for gameplay.

      The constructor performs the following operations:

      • Initializes the game pane (AnchorPane) to serve as the root container for all game elements.
      • Sets up the game scene with predefined width and height, associating it with the game pane.
      • Creates and configures the game stage, disabling resizing and setting the game scene as its content.
      • Initializes the random position generator for dynamic placement of game objects.
      • Sets up a key listener for handling player input using WASD keys for movement.

      By default:

      • The game starts in a non-fullscreen mode.
      • The game stage is configured to a fixed size to ensure a consistent user experience.
      See Also:
      • AnchorPane
      • Scene
      • Stage

  • Method Details

    • createNewGame

      public void createNewGame(javafx.stage.Stage menuStage, ANIMAL chosenAnimal, Pet chosenPet, int music_volume, int playtime_limit)
      The Loader of the game, takes the menuStage, holds it, and then loads the game stage. Using chosen animal as param. probably need to implement score and other things as param later on.
      Parameters:
      menuStage - MenuStage
      chosenAnimal - ChosenSprite
      chosenPet - the chosen pet
      music_volume - the music volume
      playtime_limit - the playtime limit

    • loadGame

      public void loadGame(Integer score)
      creating method for Loading game. it will load previous score and load music.
      Parameters:
      score - , which is the score for user.
      Throws:
      Exception - e when music file could not be loaded

    • feedButton

      private RedButton feedButton()
      Creating an in game button for Feed/Items. will be used for using in game items collected by pet to restore health and happiness
      Returns:
      the red button

    • playButton

      private RedButton playButton()
      Creating a Play button for the pet. User will be able to use the play button to play with pet to boost the happiness of the pet , while reducing rest.
      Returns:
      the red button

    • sleepButton

      private RedButton sleepButton()
      Creating the Sleep button for the pet. User will be able to use the sleep button to make the pet have some rest.
      Returns:
      the red button

    • visitVetButton

      private RedButton visitVetButton()
      Creating Visit Vet button for the pet. User will be able to take the pet to the vet with this feature, which will increase the health of the pet.
      Returns:
      the red button

    • inventoryButton

      private InventoryButton inventoryButton()
      Creating the Inventory button for pet. User can use this button to manage food and gift items for the pet!
      Returns:
      the inventory button

    • createFoodToChoose

      private javafx.scene.layout.HBox createFoodToChoose()
      Creates an HBox containing food options that the player can select from. Each food option is represented as an image that highlights on mouse hover and can be selected via click.
      Returns:
      an HBox containing food picker elements for the inventory.

    • addEscapeMenuButton

      private void addEscapeMenuButton(RedButton button)
      Adds a button to the escape menu subscene. Buttons are dynamically positioned based on the number of existing buttons in the menu.
      Parameters:
      button - the RedButton to be added to the escape menu.

    • createEscapeMenu

      private void createEscapeMenu()
      Initializes the escape menu subscene and its associated buttons, such as Resume, Save, and Exit Game. This menu allows the player to manage game settings and navigate away from the game screen.

    • createExitGameButton

      private void createExitGameButton()
      Creates and adds the "Exit Game" button to the escape menu. When clicked, this button stops the game timer, saves game progress, and returns to the main menu.

    • createSaveButton

      private void createSaveButton()
      Creates and adds the "Save" button to the escape menu. When clicked, this button opens the save subscene, allowing the player to save the current game state.

    • createSaveSubScrene

      private void createSaveSubScrene()
      Creates the save sub screen. here we create it so that user can save the game into the slots provided.

    • createLoadStartButton

      private javafx.scene.layout.HBox createLoadStartButton()
      Creates the load start button. User can access the saved games from slots they have saved in
      Returns:
      box

    • createLoadAnimalToChoose

      private RedButton createLoadAnimalToChoose()
      Creating method to choose which pet to load into. user has 4 options to load into whichever pet they want.
      Returns:
      startButton

    • shakeInputBox

      private void shakeInputBox(RedButton passwordInput)
      Creates a method to just shake input boxes when clicked User can see this when they click on a button ingame.
      Parameters:
      passwordInput - the password input

    • createSettingsButton

      private void createSettingsButton()
      Creating the settings button for the game. User can use this settings button to configure settings of the game

    • createResumeButton

      private void createResumeButton()
      Creating the resume button for the game. User can use this resume button to resume the game

    • displayEscapeMenu

      private void displayEscapeMenu()
      Creating a method to display the escape menu. It is displayed when a user hits esc from the keyboard.

    • createKeyListener

      private void createKeyListener()
      Initializes key listeners to define keybinds for the game. Users can use WASD for movement and shortcut commands for various game features. Shortcut commands: - V: Visit Vet - P: Play with Pet - Y: Put Pet to Sleep - I: Open Inventory - ESC: Open Escape Menu

    • handleVisitVetShortcut

      private void handleVisitVetShortcut()
      Handles the shortcut for visiting the vet. If the vet action is not on cooldown, executes the "Visit Vet" logic. Otherwise, displays a cooldown alert.

    • handlePlayShortcut

      private void handlePlayShortcut()
      Handles the shortcut for playing with the pet. If the play action is not on cooldown, executes the "Play with Pet" logic. Otherwise, displays a cooldown alert.

    • handleSleepShortcut

      private void handleSleepShortcut()
      Handles the shortcut for putting the pet to sleep. Executes the "Sleep" logic and updates the pet's progress bars.

    • handleInventoryShortcut

      private void handleInventoryShortcut()
      Handles the shortcut for opening the inventory. Displays the inventory subscene.

    • startPlayCooldown

      private void startPlayCooldown()
      Starts the cooldown for the play action. Sets a cooldown period of 20 seconds.

    • startVetCooldown

      private void startVetCooldown()
      Starts the cooldown for the "Visit Vet" action. Sets a cooldown period of 20 seconds during which the action cannot be executed again.

    • showCooldownAlert

      private void showCooldownAlert(String action)
      Displays an alert to the user when an action is on cooldown.
      Parameters:
      action - the name of the action that is currently on cooldown. This will be displayed in the alert message.

    • createAnimal

      private void createAnimal(ANIMAL chosenAnimal)
      Spawn the pet sprite into the world. Here user can choose what animal to choose as the character.
      Parameters:
      chosenAnimal - Your Character

    • createGameLoop

      private void createGameLoop()
      Initializes and starts the game loop. The game loop continuously updates the game by checking for collisions and moving the animal sprite. It runs on an AnimationTimer to ensure smooth gameplay.

    • gameBackGround

      private void gameBackGround()
      Sets up the background for the game. Creates a GridPane and adds the background image to it. The background image is duplicated and adjusted to fit the game window.

    • showSubSceneGame

      public void showSubSceneGame(BlueSubSceneBox subScene)
      Displays the specified subscene within the game. Toggles the visibility of a subscene when called. If the subscene is already visible, it is moved out of view; otherwise, the current subscene (if any) is hidden, and the specified subscene is displayed.
      Parameters:
      subScene - the BlueSubSceneBox to be shown.

    • moveAnimal

      private void moveAnimal()
      Handles the movement of the animal sprite based on key inputs. Updates the position of the animal sprite and ensures it wraps around the game boundaries. Uses WASD keys for movement.

    • CoinCreator

      private javafx.scene.image.ImageView CoinCreator()
      Creates and animates a coin instance for the game. The coin undergoes a continuous animation cycle, switching between predefined images to simulate a spinning or shimmering effect. It can be positioned and reused multiple times in the game environment.
      Returns:
      an ImageView instance representing a coin.

    • createItems

      private void createItems()
      Initializes all the collectible items in the game. This includes food items and coins, which are set up with specific attributes and behavior. The food items are initialized with predefined images and random positions. Coins are created with click-based scoring functionality and added to the game pane.

    • setNewElementPosition

      private void setNewElementPosition(javafx.scene.image.ImageView image)
      Randomizes the position of an item within the game boundaries. Ensures that items like food and coins are placed at random positions on the map.
      Parameters:
      image - The item whose position needs to be randomized.

    • calculateDistance

      private double calculateDistance(double x1, double x2, double y1, double y2)
      Calculates the Euclidean distance between two points in a 2D space. This is used to determine whether a collision has occurred between objects.
      Parameters:
      x1 - The x-coordinate of the first point.
      x2 - The x-coordinate of the second point.
      y1 - The y-coordinate of the first point.
      y2 - The y-coordinate of the second point.
      Returns:
      The calculated distance between the two points.

    • removeLife

      private void removeLife()
      Removes a life from the player's life count when a collision or health loss occurs. Handles game over logic if the player has no remaining lives.

    • checkIfElementsCollide

      private void checkIfElementsCollide()
      Checks for collisions between the player and game elements (food and coins). Uses the radius of sprites to calculate whether they overlap and handles the effects of the collision, such as updating scores, repositioning elements, and modifying the pet's health.

    • loadInterface

      private void loadInterface(Integer score)
      Builds the user interface for the game and loads all necessary graphics, including progress bars for health, hunger, happiness, and sleep, along with corresponding icons.
      Parameters:
      score - The current score of the player.

    • updateProgressBars

      private void updateProgressBars()
      Updates the progress bars on the game interface to reflect the current status of the pet. Progress bars include health, hunger, happiness, and sleep levels.

    • startStatusUpdateTimer

      private void startStatusUpdateTimer()
      Starts a timer to frequently update the pet's status and progress bars, as well as to check for critical levels that might trigger alerts or state changes.

    • checkDangerousLevels

      private void checkDangerousLevels()
      Checks the pet's critical levels for hunger, sleep, happiness, and health. Displays warnings if any of these levels fall below a dangerous threshold and triggers game-over logic if necessary.

    • handleGameOver

      private void handleGameOver()
      Handles the game-over logic when the pet dies or reaches an unplayable state. Stops all game timers, saves the current game state, and displays a game-over alert.

    • startCoinRespawnTimer

      private void startCoinRespawnTimer()
      Start coin respawn timer.

    • respawnNextCoin

      private void respawnNextCoin()
      Respawn next coin.

    • updateScore

      private void updateScore(int points, String reason)
      Updates the score without displaying pop-up messages.
      Parameters:
      points - Points to add (or subtract if negative)
      reason - Message to display (unused, kept for debugging)
